text: Math 317 Homework 1 Name 1. Let a, c > 0 be positive constants. Find the velocity, speed and acceleration at time t of the particle whose position is ⃗r (t) = a cos t ̂ııı + a sin t ̂ + ct ̂k . Describe the path of the particle. 2. Find a vector function that represents the curve of intersection of (a) the cone z = √ x2 + y2 and the plane z = 1 + y. (b) the plane z = 2x + 3y and the cylinder x2 + y2 = 9 3. (a) Sketch the plane curve given by the vector equation ⃗r(t) = 4 sin t̂ııı − 2 cos t̂ . (b) Let 0 ≤ θ ≤ π be the angle between ⃗r(t) and ⃗r ′(t) at t = 3π/4. Here θ is the angle between both vectors emanating from the origin. Compute cos θ and determine whether θ < π/2, θ = π/2, or θ > π/2. (c) Sketch the position vector ⃗r(t) and the tangent vector ⃗r′(t) at t = 3π/4. In this sketch, ⃗r(t) is emanating from the origin and ⃗r′(t) starts from the tip of ⃗r(t). 4. Find the velocity and position vectors of a particle that has the given acceleration and the given initial velocity and position: ⃗a(t) = sin t̂ııı + 2 cos t̂ + 6t ̂k , ⃗v(0) = − ̂k , ⃗r(0) = ̂ − 4 ̂k . 5. Find parametric equations for the tangent line to the curve x = e −t cos t, y = e −t sin t, z = e −t at the point (1, 0, 1). 6. Let C be the curve of intersection of the parabolic cylinder x2 = 2y and the surface 3z = xy. Find the length of C from the origin to the point (6, 18, 36). 7. Find the arc length function of the curve ⃗r(t) = t 2̂ııı + 9t̂ + 4t 3/2 ̂k , 0 < t < ∞ measured from the point P = ⃗r(1) in the direction of increasing t. 8. Find the arc length function for the curve ⃗r(t) = e t sin t̂ııı + e t cos t̂ + √2e t ̂k measured from the point P (0, 1, √ 2) in the direction of increasing t, and then reparametrize the curve with respect to arc length starting from P .
